text: welcome to Don Juan a city with idyllic
charm and blooming with opportunities a
city which you think you might know but
which holds many surprises in Don Juan
you'll find widespread prostitution in
China's sex capital a cultural hub for
opera and basketball air pollution and
factory buildings the world's top
digital manufacturers illegal drugs and
gambling historical landmarks including
an opium incinerator Don Juan's negative
image became all too real after chinese
state media exposed rampant prostitution
their Internet users have since been at
pains to defend the city's reputation
initially people were angry at the way
Don Juan was picked on and very shortly
Weibo and WeChat users started a
campaign highlighting the other side of
Don Juan and people are also sharing a
blog apparently written by a migrant
worker in Don Juan who describes the
daily life in the city which seems to be
Mars apart from the world of sex workers
it's difficult to pinpoint who started
the trend the city's information board
says where there's contradiction
there's also beauty so is it fair to
call Don Juan China's sex capital or our
social media users right to point out
the positive conflicting views about the
city's image remain
